alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:04PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Haskell and northern Throckmorton Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 503 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from near Weinert east into northern Throckmorton County, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Throckmorton, Weinert, Millers Creek Reservoir, Us- 183 Near The Throckmorton-Baylor County Line, Us- 277 Near The Haskell-Knox County Line and The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
